'''PC-BSD''' is a [[Unix-like]], desktop-oriented [[operating system]] based on [[FreeBSD]]. It aims to be easy to install by using a [[graphical]] installation program, and easy and ready-to-use immediately by providing [[KDE]] as the default, pre-installed [[graphical user interface]]. PC-BSD provides official binary [[nVidia]] and [[Intel]] drivers for easy hardware acceleration and an optional 3D desktop interface through [[Compiz Fusion]]. PC-BSD also contains a unique [[package management system]] which allows users to graphically install [[Executable|pre-built]] software packages from a single downloaded executable file. In August 2006 it was voted the most beginner friendly operating system by OSWeekly.com.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.osweekly.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=2287&Itemid=449|title=The Most Beginner Friendly OS|accessdate=2006-08-10}}</ref>
+
'''PC-BSD''' is a [[Unix-like]], desktop-oriented [[operating system]] based on [[FreeBSD]]. It aims to be easy to install by using a [[graphical]] installation program, and easy and ready-to-use immediately by providing [[KDE]] as the default, pre-installed [[graphical user interface]]. PC-BSD provides official binary [[nVidia]] and [[Intel]] drivers for easy hardware acceleration and an optional 3D desktop interface through [[Compiz Fusion]]. PC-BSD also contains a [[package management system]] which allows users to graphically install [[Executable|pre-built]] software packages from a single downloaded executable file. In August 2006 it was voted the most beginner friendly operating system by OSWeekly.com.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.osweekly.com/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=2287&Itemid=449|title=The Most Beginner Friendly OS|accessdate=2006-08-10}}</ref>
Since [[October 10]], [[2006]] PC-BSD has been supported by the enterprise-class hardware solution provider [[iXsystems]].<sup>[http://www.pcbsd.org/index.php?id=54]</sup> In November 2007, iXsystems entered into a distribution agreement with [[Fry's Electronics]] whereby Fry's Electronics stores nationwide carry boxed copies of PC-BSD version 1.4 (Da Vinci Edition).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pcbsd.org/content/view/41/1/|title=iXsystems Announces Distribution Agreement with Fry's Electronics|accessdate=2008-01-02}}</ref> In January 2008, iXsystems entered into a similar agreement with [[Micro Center]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pcbsd.org/content/view/51/1/|title=Micro Center carries PC-BSD!|accessdate=2008-01-02}}</ref>
Since [[October 10]], [[2006]] PC-BSD has been supported by the enterprise-class hardware solution provider [[iXsystems]].<sup>[http://www.pcbsd.org/index.php?id=54]</sup> In November 2007, iXsystems entered into a distribution agreement with [[Fry's Electronics]] whereby Fry's Electronics stores nationwide carry boxed copies of PC-BSD version 1.4 (Da Vinci Edition).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pcbsd.org/content/view/41/1/|title=iXsystems Announces Distribution Agreement with Fry's Electronics|accessdate=2008-01-02}}</ref> In January 2008, iXsystems entered into a similar agreement with [[Micro Center]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pcbsd.org/content/view/51/1/|title=Micro Center carries PC-BSD!|accessdate=2008-01-02}}</ref>
